extraction_metadata.notes: This trial features extensive witness testimony (21 witnesses) documenting a reputation spanning up to 40 years across multiple villages (Sermemont, Herbemont, Gripport). The accused and his late wife Isabel were both suspected. Notable features include: dramatic confrontation with Bietrix before her execution; Nicolas's ecstatic fit interpreted as demonic possession; use of counter-magic (devineresse, holy water, blessed bread/salt); massive economic losses (over 2,000 francs in animals for one family); confession obtained under torture after initial voluntary confession; detailed testimony about visiting Beau Bernard for healing and Bainville sur Illon for divination. Trial shows complex social dynamics including property disputes, competition over employment (herd-keeping), and family conflicts. The accused initially denied all charges, then confessed voluntarily after an ecstatic episode, and later under torture confessed to additional animal deaths but consistently denied harming people.
